title.value: Sensing Wellbeing in the Workplace, Why and For Whom?
title.justification: This is the main title of the research paper as indicated.
title.quote: Sensing Wellbeing in the Workplace, Why and For Whom?

extractions.description: This paper explores the implications and potential impacts of deploying passive sensing technologies to track and support employee wellbeing in workplace environments, especially in light of remote and hybrid work prompted by the COVID-19 pandemic. The study is based on interviews with 33 participants across three stakeholder groups: organizational governors, AI builders, and worker data subjects.

type.justification: The paper conducts empirical research through storyboard-driven interviews with 33 participants to gather their perspectives.
type.quote: In this study, we conduct storyboard-driven interviews with 33 participants across three stakeholder groups: organizational governors, AI builders, and worker data subjects.

name.justification: The paper focuses on understanding how passive sensing technologies can impact workplace wellbeing from a human-computer interaction perspective.
